title: Bookmarks & Daily Links reset issues...
content:
Has anyone noticed that the Bookmark's / Daily Links 'pointer' gets reset to top of the list after selecting a bookmark?

Seeing this issue on a PC with Windows 7 Ultimate 64 bit.

I.e. (Example only) Say a user has 100 bookmarks on main toolbar [many bookmarks saved under Daily Links or under the ">>" icon] ...and user chooses any stored link/bookmark, say for example, ...approximately link/bookmark #50; that tab opens okay. After doing so, maybe user chooses to open another link in same listing nearby-say #51 bookmark in a new tab browser window (multitasking etc.), ...often now, user gets put to top of said list, to bookmark#1 (especially after ) selecting a saved bookmark by clicking on either the ">>" icon or selecting "Daily Links".

In my experience with Firefox, this action never reverted back to top of either list prior to latest 110.0 update (64bit). I haven't tried issue to see if repeated on Windows 10 or higher yet. Appreciate any insight or bug solution to this scrolling issue using bookmark toolbars.
creator: lansharkbyte

title: New tabs (and sometimes already open tabs) won't load properly
content: Hello! I recently switched from Chrome to Firefox on both my stationary and my laptop. It works great on my laptop. However, on my stationary a lot of the times when I open a new tab, and sometimes (rarely) when I try to open another webpage in an already open tab (by typing in the new url, not clicking links), the tab won't load for quite some time. Then after a while it seems to reset itself and works. If I have typed in an url and wait where it shows suggestions, it resets whatever I have typed into the address field. This does not seem to happen if I type an address, press enter and wait. The problem happens regardless of extensions/addons. It's fairly annoying so I would like to find a fix, but I understand that since this doesn't happen on my laptop at all, it might not be the browser that is the problem.

creator: 4johnherman

title: Cookie management in Firefox
content: Despite have used Firefox for many years, I am still not completely clear on why there are two separate areas for cookie settings, and how everything works together. In Cookies and Site Data: I check Delete cookies and site data when Firefox is closed. In Manage Exceptions, the listed domains I choose will not be deleted, but all other domains will. Correct? In History: I uncheck Always use private browsing mode, and I check Clear History when Firefox closes. In the Clear Recent History box, I uncheck Cookies and Site Settings. Question: Will be above choices in both areas get me where I want to be, which is retaining cookies for chosen protected sites, while deleting cookies for all others whenever Firefox is closed? If this is where a lot of people want to be, why are these choices presented in such a complicated way? If relevant, under Enhanced Tracking Protection I choose Custom, and leave all the boxes checked. The sites I choose to use seem to perform well with this option. Is this Security & Privacy area in Settings in need of reworking for ease and clarity?

Also your company still has not corrected the problems with updates in Firefox. I have my browser set to notify me of updates, and to allow me to install them at my discretion. title: Mit ID Denmark- Page https://nemlog-in.mitid.dk/login.aspx/mitid
content: We use Mozilla at my work and are happy with it. In Denmark, both private individuals and companies have a security key called MIT ID ( My Id ) So we can log in to all public adminsrative sites. It is very important. After your last update it doesn't work. I am getting an error, and have spoken to Support and they say it is an error in your update. It has now been a week and the error has not been made. Which forces us to use a different browser, which I'd rather not. The Site with the error is https://nemlog-in.mitid.dk/login.aspx/mitid

title: posuv na stránkách kolečkem myši
content:
Dobrý den,

přestalo mi ve Firefoxu fungovat posouvání na stránce pomocí kolečka myši. V jiných aplikacích i prohlížečích funguje bez problémů. Ale v Mozille se nyní posunu na stránce pouze pomocí tlačítek na klávesnici, nebo přidržením a tahem posuvníku na pravé straně stránky. Problém nastal zničeho nic po zapnutí počítače. Takže nevím, jestli je na vině nějaká aktualizace, ale já jsem v počítači již delší dobu nic neměnil ani neinstaloval.

Vyzkoušel jsem obnovu Firefoxu i jeho reinstalaci (včetně promazání registrů), ale bohužel nic nepomáhá.

Myš je drátová, Gigabyte M6880X. V počítači 64 bit systém, WIN 10 Pro, verze 22H2.

Předem děkuji za pomoc.

Jiří

title: Uso das fragilidades do JavaScript
content:
Olá, tudo bom? Gostaria de lançar uma pergunta simples e direta para a turma da comunidade, pois não encontrei respostas ainda para tal pergunta e outros assuntos. O MOZILLA, tem algum tempo afirmando ter desenvolvido uma VPN para garantir o ANONIMATO do dados em fluxo. O Mozilla, solucionou todos os problemas de HACKEAMENTO que o uso do JAVASCRIPT proporciona? O Mozilla, conseguiu resolver os problemas de HACKEAMENTO, que impedi o atacante de usar a ATUALIZAÇÃO do NAVEGADOR para instalar um versão maliciosa? Última pergunta, o antigo TOR PROJECT, desenvolvido utilizando o NAVEGADOR MOZILLA, e que por anos foi confiável, ainda poderá ser utilizado pelos DESENVOLVEDORES do MOZILLA para criar uma conexão mais segura para seus usuários, através de RELÉS DE CONEXÃO para manter o anonimato do FLUXO DE DADOS?

A REDE TOR, de alguns anos para cá teve sua privacidade quebrada expondo muitos dos usuários, e com certeza todos nós usuários de BROWSER iremos agradecer a desenvolvedores que devolvam a liberdade de acesso a informações globais. Acabando com a tirania daqueles que "tentam" impedir o acesso a dados em toda a rede global.

Atenciosamente,
creator: magazinepandavendas

title: accesso locale per gestione router impedito: [Connessione sicura non riuscita] !!!
content:
salve,

pur settando il permesso di aprire i popup (per il login sicuro, che il router chiede) all'idirizzo IP locale (192.168.1.1) dentro Home Assistant (hub per gestione iot domestico) stranamente non compare l'opzione di procedere a proprio rischio: [Accetta il rischo e continua], come invece Firefox fa se provo l'accesso da barra degli indirizzi con l'IP del router. c'è modo per bypassare questo ostacolo, unicamente per questo IP locale, che non può NON ESSERE sicuro: tutto il traffico DATI transita attraverso quel dispositivo, se non fosse sicuro lui, allora non ci sarebbe salvezza, (oppure nessuna navigazione), nei confronti di attacchi malevoli.

router TP-Link AX3000 connesso ad extender (WA-860RE), via rete Ethernet, al quale range extender viene dato accesso ad internet da uno smartphone, (via rete WiFi), usato come hotspot. in attesa di arrivo della fibra (ora sono in corso lavori a 2 o 300metri dalla via dove risiedo).

grazie 1000 per l'attenzione, buon tempo & salute.
creator: patber.62
